title: Adam Sandler and Jennifer Aniston being wooed for Murder Mystery sequel after summer success
text:
It was a huge hit when it bowed on Netflix on June 14, grabbing almost 31 million views in the first 72 hours

So it's little wonder that the streaming service is trying to recruit Adam Sandler, 53, and Jennifer Aniston, 50, to do a follow up to Murder Mystery.

The original screenwriter James Vanderbilt, 43, is also in negotiations to create the new script.

Scroll down for video

It's a winner: Netflix is trying to recruit Adam Sandler, 53, and Jennifer Aniston, 50, to do a follow up to their highly successful Murder Mystery movie

Murder Mystery followed a married couple who somehow get involved in a murder plot while on vacation in Europe.

It also starred Luke Evans, 40; Terence Stamp, 81; Gemma Arterton, 33, and David Walliams, 48.

Directed by Kyle Newacheck, 35, its huge number of views set a new record for Netflix.

Adam has a deal with Netflix and he co-produced the movie with James, Tripp Vinson, James D. Stern and A.J. Dix.

The comedy drama reunited Adam and Jennifer, who haven't starred together since Just Go With It in 2011.

Compelling viewing: The story of a couple who get mixed up in a murder on their European vacation, grabbed almost 31 million views in the first 72 hours, a new record for Netflix

Meanwhile, Jennifer is presently prepping sitcom The Morning Show with Steve Carell, about the team of a morning TV show, due to debut on November 1 on Apple TV.

The Friends star also has drama The Fixer in pre-production and an untitled project set up with Sophie Goodhart.

Adam has three projects on the go.

Uncut Gems, due out on December 25; comedy Hubie Halloween which has yet to set a date, and Hotel Transylvania 4 in which he voices Dracula, set for release on December 22, 2021.
